intro: Scopulophila rixfordii, commonly known as the Rixford's rock orchid, is a rare and specialized orchid species native to specific regions of South America. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is typically found in mountainous or coastal habitats. The plant has slender, erect stems with few leaves, and its flowers are small, fragrant, and often have a unique coloration. It is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, relying on mycorrhizal associations for nutrient uptake. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Scopulophila rixfordii is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
